description: Unique identifier for the authenticated user session instance, used to tie activity until expiration.
Application login ID of the user who owns this session.
User’s workgroup or business unit used to scope access and data visibility.
Default warehouse/site context applied during the session; likely a location code used by inventory workflows; confirm with SME.
Client device identifier initiating the session (hostname or captured endpoint identifier); used for auditing and security.
Client IP observed for the session, for auditing, security controls, and possible geolocation.
Encoded effective permissions for the session (bitmask/role string determining allowed actions); encoding is proprietary; confirm with SME.
User or process that created this session record.
Date and time the session record was created.
User or process that last modified this session record.
Date and time this session record was last updated.
Indicator (Y/N) of whether this is the user’s primary/master session versus a secondary one; confirm semantics with SME.
Effective username under which the session runs (normalized, aliased, or impersonated account); confirm behavior with SME.
Code indicating session context/type (e.g., desktop, device, API, service); refer to code list; confirm meanings with SME.
Name or label of the authentication token/provider associated with the session; often unused.
Free-text notes about the session for audit or troubleshooting.
Scheduled date and time when this session expires.
Opaque token used to renew access or obtain a new session without re-authentication; handle securely.
Identifier of the previous session superseded by the current one (e.g., after refresh/renewal).
Expiration timestamp of the previous session superseded by the current one.
Client or application version associated with the session at login, used for support and compatibility checks.
